ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 1. What time do you get up each day (average weekday)
"Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 1. What time do you get up each day (average weekend, if different)"
"Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 2. How many hours do you spend alone? (eg. Alone in a room, walking out alone, listening to the radio or watching TV alone ect.)"
Notes: 3=(0-3 hours spent alone) Very little time spent alone; 2=(3-6 hours alone) Some of the time; 1=(6-9 hours spent alone) Quite a lot of time; 0=(9-12 hours spent alone) A great deal of time; 0=(12 hours spent alone) Practically all the time; 99=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 3. How often will you start a conversation at home?
Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 4. How often do you leave the house (for any reason)?
Social Engagement/Withdrawal. 5. How do you react to the presence of strangers?
Notes: 0=Avoid them; 1=Feel nervous; 2=Accept them; 3=Like them; 99=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Interpersonal Communication. 1.How many friends do you have at the moment?
Interpersonal Communication. 2.Do you have a boy \ girlfriend of are you married?
"interpersonal Communication. Total of 1 & 2 (items 1 & 2 are added together, the highest score is 3)"
Interpersonal Communication. 3.How often are you able to carry out a sensible or rational conversation?
Notes: Almost never=0, Rarely=1, Sometimes=2, Often=3; 99=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: Interpersonal Communication. 4.How easy or difficult do you find it talking to people at the moment?
Notes: Very easy=3, Quite easy=3, Average=2, Quite difficult=1, Very difficult=0; 99=Prefer not to answer
